results.title:
Radio Rythm, No. A9-1-2A
Vitaphone record
results.brief_description: Vitaphone was a sound film system used for feature films and nearly 1,000 short subjects made by Warner Bros. and its sister studio First National from 1926 to 1931. Vitaphone was the last major analog sound-on-disc system and the only one which was widely used and commercially successful.
results.description: Vitaphone was a sound film system used for feature films and nearly 1,000 short subjects made by Warner Bros. and its sister studio First National from 1926 to 1931. Vitaphone was the last major analog sound-on-disc system and the only one which was widely used and commercially successful.

results.title: Charles Hackett, 392 Reel Three Vitaphone record
results.brief_description:

results.title: Eumig 8mm Film Splicer
results.brief_description: Eumig splicer in box with instruction booklet in German, Italian and English. This object was originally catalogued in the East Anglian Film Archive Donation with a Eumig P8 Projector (E000255) and Prora 8mm Editor Viewer. Catalogue entries separated.
results.description: Eumig splicer in box with instruction booklet in German, Italian and English. This object was originally catalogued in the East Anglian Film Archive Donation with a Eumig P8 Projector (E000255) and Prora 8mm Editor Viewer. Catalogue entries separated.

results.title: Prora 8mm Editor Viewer
results.brief_description: Prora 8mm Editor Viewer with authenticity certificate. Was originally catalogued in East Anglian Film Archive Donation with a Eumig P8 Projector (E000255) and Eumig Film Splicer (E000265). Catalogue entries separated.

results.title: Bib 3mm Casette Tape Editing and Joining Kit
results.brief_description:
Bib 3mm Casette Tape Editing and Joining Kit in Yellow and clear plastic wallet
Contains
-Bib Recording Tape Splicer (Made in England)
-Index Cards for Cassette container labels
-Self adhesive stickers for casettes (with handwriting “POP SONGS AND / COMMUNITY SINGING”)
-Razor blade
